title: Change or delete spear of shojin.
body:
I think that this item is kinda meh for a lot of champions, but on a few It just works like a superman buff. Just was playing{{champion:24}}  and bought spear of shojin after {{item:3078}} and{{item:3077}} . I just popped my r and went in on 3 enemy squad with my e. How funny it was when I just stunned them and after 1 sec I just popped my e again, They couldnt do anything due to my e dodge and r, I just deleted them. Just i felt for a moment like on urf with jax, while i have jump every second. The only problem was that after that i was drained out of mana.
Now I think how op is this item on {{champion:58}} {{champion:92}} which even dont have mana, and also it boosts hp and cdr . Not to mention good {{champion:92}} is almost 1v5 champion even without this item.
This item just gives too much powerspike for certain champions, and the truth is that even without it, they will still be good. Why should they have such an op item.

> when damage is taken in DoT it is reduced by armor more often

What??

Both magic and attack damage DoTs, their damage is reduced by resistances. 

Examples: If you get hit by Malz E, your mr reduces each tick's damage by however amount. If it did 10 dps and you had 50% resistances you would only take 5 dps. Same works for Darius bleed.

This is why Zoe's Bubble does true damage. The ability wants to double (or increase by however percent before that rank) the damage of whatever hits it so it makes the second damage do true. Lets say you get hit with a Zoe Q while sleeping that does 1000 magic damage. To make it double, the bubble wants to do 1000 more damage to make 2000. BUT if it did 1000 magic damage and you had 50% resistances it would do 500 and then altogether 1,500. That's why it makes it 1000 TRUE damage so that it correctly deals 2000 damage altogether. 

You can apply this to this situation with Death's Dance's passive.

DD's Passive deals TRUE damage. The only time your resistance reduces the damage is when you first get hit, then DD's takes 15% of that damage u where going to take and turns it into a TRUE DoT.

So no Resistance does not double stack on DD's

Also Resistance affects DoTs the exact same as flat damage.

DoT: 100 Damage over 10 Seconds. 10 per second. 50% resistance turns it into 50 damage over 10 seconds or 5 per second.

Flat: 100 Damage. 50% resistance turns it into 50 damage. 

Its simple math, resistance does the exact same vs Flat as it does Vs DoT
Either way death's dance flat to dot conversion ratio going up is a benefit
yep

damage and cc riven, and she takes true damage instead.

Its actually insane, when you count cc factor. Just as an example : morgana q, ryze w, etc. then all will do true damage and riven cannot do shit about it.
Lastly, this was in v7.9 patch, it was 2 seasons ago. I don't understand how that suddenly makes you erupt "I feel like Riven still benefits a bit too much from the Death's Dance changes a while back".

Its not "take 30% of the damage as true damage" because that's how it works, it would be just like Zoe's bubble where it does true damage so that it allows it to mimic damage it was supposed to double. 

Like I said before, if it wasn't true damage it would severely reduce the amount of damage someone takes because for every tick you take your armor reduces the damage rather than reducing the full damage once. 

In this case, the game reads 30% of the damage you were supposed to take (after being reduced by armor) and then makes it so you take it over a longer period of time in the form of a DoT. It HAS to be true damage otherwise your armor would keep reducing each tick of damage, and we don't want that, we want it to do the same exact amount.

Also idk who you are quoting because that isn't me, I am simply stating that the Death Dance DoT changes are entirely a buff.
